```{r}
plot_avg_adjusted_inflation <- function(data,
                                        balloon_col = "trial_number",
                                        color_col = "balloon_color",
                                        inflation_col = "inflations",
                                        popped_col = "popped",
                                        participant_col = "participant_id",
                                        save_path = "avg_adjusted_inflation_plot.png") {
  library(dplyr)
  library(ggplot2)
  
  # Filter to blue and orange, and only unpopped trials
  filtered <- data %>%
    filter(!!sym(color_col) %in% c("b", "o"),
           !!sym(popped_col) == 0)
  
  # Compute summary: mean, SEM, and N per trial/color
  summary <- filtered %>%
    group_by(trial = !!sym(balloon_col), color = !!sym(color_col)) %>%
    summarise(
      mean_inflation = mean(!!sym(inflation_col), na.rm = TRUE),
      sd_inflation = sd(!!sym(inflation_col), na.rm = TRUE),
      n = n(),
      sem = sd_inflation / sqrt(n),
      .groups = "drop"
    )
  
  # Print participant counts per color per trial
  message("Participants per trial (unpopped only):")
  print(summary %>% select(trial, color, n) %>% arrange(trial, color))
  
  # Plot
  p <- ggplot(summary, aes(x = trial, y = mean_inflation, color = color, group = color)) +
    # Background shading
    annotate("rect", xmin = -Inf, xmax = Inf, ymin = -Inf, ymax = 8,
             fill = "grey90", alpha = 0.5) +
    annotate("rect", xmin = -Inf, xmax = Inf, ymin = 8, ymax = Inf,
             fill = "grey80", alpha = 0.5) +
    
    # Error bars
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = mean_inflation - sem, ymax = mean_inflation + sem),
                  width = 0.3, size = 0.5, alpha = 0.8) +
    
    # Lines (disconnected by color & trial â€” avoids jumps)
    geom_line(data = summary, aes(group = color), size = 0.8, na.rm = TRUE) +
    
    # Threshold lines
    geom_vline(xintercept = 91, linetype = "dashed", color = "black") +
    geom_hline(yintercept = 8, linetype = "dashed", color = "black") +
    
    # Colors
    scale_color_manual(values = c("b" = "blue", "o" = "orange")) +
    
    # Labels
    annotate("text", x = Inf, y = 7.5, label = "Low Value", hjust = 1.1, vjust = 1.2, size = 3.5) +
    annotate("text", x = Inf, y = 8.5, label = "High Value", hjust = 1.1, vjust = -0.2, size = 3.5) +
    
    labs(
      title = "Average Adjusted Inflations",
      x = "Trial",
      y = "Inflations"
    ) +
    theme_minimal() +
    theme(legend.position = "none")
  
  # Print
  print(p)
  
  # Save with white background
  ggsave(save_path, plot = p, width = 10, height = 6, dpi = 600, bg = "white")
}

plot_avg_adjusted_inflation(df)
```


```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(Hmisc)
library(reshape2)

# Variables
vars_to_include <- c(
  "average_inflation_rt", "total_score", "total_pops", "total_inactive", "task_time",
  "spq_total_score", "ipip_total_score", "adjusted_inflations",
  "spq_total", "ipip_total", "pdi_total", "pdi_distress", "pdi_frequency",
  "pdi_conviction", "caps_total", "caps_distress", "caps_intrusiveness", "caps_frequency", "phq_total",
  "ppgm_total", "mdq_total"
)

# Clean and correlate
df_corr <- df %>%
  select(any_of(vars_to_include)) %>%
  mutate(across(everything(), as.numeric)) %>%
  drop_na()

corr_res <- rcorr(as.matrix(df_corr))
r <- corr_res$r
p <- corr_res$P

# Melt matrices
r_melt <- melt(r)
p_melt <- melt(p)
colnames(r_melt) <- c("Var1", "Var2", "r")
colnames(p_melt) <- c("Var1", "Var2", "p")

# Get upper triangle only
heatmap_df <- left_join(r_melt, p_melt, by = c("Var1", "Var2")) %>%
  filter(as.integer(factor(Var1, levels = vars_to_include)) <
         as.integer(factor(Var2, levels = vars_to_include))) %>%
  mutate(
    sig = case_when(
      p < 0.001 ~ "***",
      p < 0.01 ~ "**",
      p < 0.05 ~ "*",
      TRUE ~ ""
    ),
    label = ifelse(p < 0.05, paste0(sprintf("%.2f", r), "\n", sig), "")
  )

# Set factor levels
heatmap_df$Var1 <- factor(heatmap_df$Var1, levels = vars_to_include)
heatmap_df$Var2 <- factor(heatmap_df$Var2, levels = vars_to_include)

# Plot
p <- ggplot(heatmap_df, aes(x = Var2, y = Var1, fill = r)) +
  geom_tile(color = "white") +
  geom_text(aes(label = label), size = 3.5, na.rm = TRUE) +
  scale_fill_gradient2(low = "blue", mid = "white", high = "red", midpoint = 0,
                       limits = c(-1, 1), name = "r", na.value = "grey90") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  labs(
    title = "Correlation Map",
    x = NULL, y = NULL
  ) +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 10, angle = 45, hjust = 1),
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10),
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)
  )

# Show
print(p)

# Save clean plot
ggsave("correlation_map_upper_triangle.png", p, width = 9, height = 8, dpi = 600, bg = "white")
```
